org.jcatapult.persistence
Interface PersistenceService

All Known Implementing Classes:
JPAPersistenceService
public interface PersistenceService

This interface defines the core CRUD operations for any object.

Method Detail

clearCache

void clearCache()
This is mostly a hack to get around Hibernate's sometimes aggrevating caching. This clears any persistence cache that the implementation behind this interface might have. This forces any objects that are fetched to come directly from the database.

reload

void reload(Object obj)
This forces the given Object to be reloaded from the database.

Parameters:
obj - The object to reload.

startTransaction

Transaction startTransaction()
Starts a transaction and returns a transaction facade.

Returns:
The transaction facade and never null.

lock

void lock(Object obj,
          boolean read)
This forces the given Object to be locked at the database level.

Parameters:
obj - The object to lock.
read - If this is true, the lock will be a read lock. If it is false, the lock will be a write lock. Read locks provide that the readability of the object will be serial. That is that the most current value in the database will always be accessible to all transactions. Write locks usually imply that only transactions that contain the most current data will be allowed to write to the object.

findAllByType

<T> List<T> findAllByType(Class<T> type)
This locates all instances of an Object by class. This could be extremely heavy weight if the number of Objects of the type are large. Therefore, only use this method when you know that the total number of Object instances in the DB is low.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findAllByType

<T extends SoftDeletable> List<T> findAllByType(Class<T> type,
                                                boolean includeDeleted)
This locates all instances of an Object by class. This could be extremely heavy weight if the number of Objects of the type are large. Therefore, only use this method when you know that the total number of Object instances in the DB is low.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findByType

<T> List<T> findByType(Class<T> type,
                       int start,
                       int number)
This locates a subset of all the instances of an Object by class. This helps when paginating over all of the instances of a specific type.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

findByType

<T extends SoftDeletable> List<T> findByType(Class<T> type,
                                             int start,
                                             int number,
                                             boolean includeDeleted)
This locates a subset of all the instances of an Object by class. This helps when paginating over all of the instances of a specific type.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should return all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

count

<T> long count(Class<T> type)
Determines the total number of instances of the type given. If these are SoftDeletable Objects, this will include all the deleted objects as well.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to count.
Returns:
A total number of Objects in the database.

count

<T extends SoftDeletable> long count(Class<T> type,
                                     boolean includeDeleted)
Determines the total number of instances of the type given.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to count.
includeDeleted - Determines if this should count all the instances of the Object including those instances that are marked as deleted and are SoftDeletable objects.
Returns:
A total number of Objects in the database.

queryAll

<T> List<T> queryAll(Class<T> type,
                     String query,
                     Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns all of the results from the query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

query

<T> List<T> query(Class<T> type,
                  String query,
                  int start,
                  int number,
                  Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns a subset of the results from the query. This method is useful for paginating over a search results from a query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

queryFirst

<T> T queryFirst(Class<T> type,
                 String query,
                 Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns the first result from the query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The EJB3 query language query string.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
The first result if there are 1 or more results, otherwise null.

queryCount

long queryCount(String query,
                Object... params)
Executes the given query and returns the count. This assumees that the query is a count query rather than a object query.

Parameters:
query - The EJB3 query language query string that returns a count.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
The number of results that executing the query would return.

namedQueryAll

<T> List<T> namedQueryAll(Class<T> type,
                          String query,
                          Object... params)
Executes the given named query and returns all the results from the query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The named query.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

namedQuery

<T> List<T> namedQuery(Class<T> type,
                       String query,
                       int start,
                       int number,
                       Object... params)
Executes the given named query and returns a subset of the results from the query. This method is useful for paginating over a search results from a query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The named query.
start - The location in the total set of possible Objects to start from. This is zero based.
number - The number of results to return in this page.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
A List of the Objects found in the database.

namedQueryFirst

<T> T namedQueryFirst(Class<T> type,
                      String query,
                      Object... params)
Executes the given named query and returns the first result from the query.

Parameters:
type - The type of Objects to fetch.
query - The named query.
params - A list of parameters that are parameterized within the query string (e.g. select user from User user where firstName = ?1). These are 1 based within the query String.
Returns:
The first result if there are 1 or more results, otherwise null.

findById

<T extends Identifiable> T findById(Class<T> type,
                                    int id)
Locates the entity with the given type and primary key (id).

Parameters:
type - The type of Object to fetch.
id - The primary key of the Object to fetch.
Returns:
The Object or null if it doesn't exist.

persist

boolean persist(Object obj)
Saves or updates the object to the database.

Parameters:
obj - The object to persist.
Returns:
True if the object was persisted. False if the object was not persisted because of a unique key constraint.
Throws:
PersistenceException - If there were any database issues while persisting the Object. This does not include unique key exceptions (i.e. EntityExistsException).

delete

<T extends Identifiable> boolean delete(Class<T> type,
                                        int id)
Removes the object with the given type and primary key. Since this uses a primary key to remove the instance, this method will only work with identified instances. In addition, if the object type passed in is SoftDeletable than this method will update the active flag and perform an update rather than a delete.

Parameters:
type - The type of Object to remove.
id - The primary key of the Object to remove.
Returns:
True if the entity was removed, false if it wasn't because it doesn't exist.

delete

void delete(Object obj)
Removes the given object. If the object type passed in is SoftDeletable than this method will update the active flag and perform an update rather than a delete.

Parameters:
obj - The Object to remove.
